items.sentence: If you can't explain it easily, you don't yet understand it.
That's a good story. The only problem is that it's not true.
There's no danger of this lamp setting fire to the curtains.
I had a hard time trying to talk him out of taking the trip.
Things have changed a lot since the last time you were here.
It makes no difference to me whether you wear a suit or not.
It doesn't make any difference to me whether you go or stay.
It was crazy for you to go outside during a storm like that.
Tom's violin was stolen by the man who broke into his house.
What really matters the most is how we deal with this issue.
Do you have a pencil sharpener? I need to sharpen my pencil.
Tom is a thirteen-year-old boy who lives in my neighborhood.
I have two sons. One is in Tokyo and the other is in Nagoya.
I'm sorry. There must be some mistake. I didn't order pizza.
I'm still going to do it, no matter how much it bothers you.
I went to the book store and bought a very interesting book.
The team needs to define the scope of the project by Monday.
Recently there has been a lot of talk about remote teaching.
Tom doesn't get along well with the other boys in his class.
You can choose a path, but not the people you'll meet on it.
